page.title: 13ECOLOGY
page.content: Soil variations - from Ashton Common's clays, Hinton's sandy loam, to Steeple Ashton's rich calcerous soil - produce very good flora for the 130 bird, 35 butterfly, over 1000 moth species, and other fauna in local habitat. Many tree species enjoy temperal climate, all regenerating from seed, though replanting continues after Dutch Elm disease killed vast numbers, since when the ash shows natural increase . Road traffic threatens fauna. Recent victims, their rate increasing,include various birds, the deer, fox, badger, weasel, stoat, squirrel,rabbit, hedgehog, bat and many small mammals. Some changes continue - eg Barn Owls decrease, but history shows increase usually follows (Collared Doves did not exist in U.K. in 1965 but now breed regularly here). Many footpaths still accessible.
